revised_title: Electron Microscopy of Glio-Vascular Organization in Octopus Brain
tldr: The article examines the glio-vascular organization of the octopus brain using electron microscopy. It describes the structure of blood vessels, two types of neuroglia, and enigmatic dark cells. The study also highlights the complex network of glio-vascular strands in the brain, which contain collagen, smooth muscle cells, and fibrocytes. The findings provide insights into the relationship between blood vessels, neuroglia, neuronal perikarya, and neuropil in the octopus brain.
